story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_length
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Length. Atlas Mountain Race is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Atlas Mountain Race? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Atlas Mountain Race scored 63 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Atlas Mountain Race?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Atlas Mountain Race. Morocco. 750 mi. Atlas Mountains ultra-endurance self-supported gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Length. 5 out of 5. Your legs will remember this one for weeks. Rory Stuart finished in "6 days 4 hours 45 minutes but later reflected: I wholeheartedly think I did pretty darn well. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Relentless vertical. The climbing never stops. The 2026 route includes Tizi N'Aït Imi—the highest pass at 2,910m—replacing the iconic Telouet Pass. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Full expedition mode. Genuine backcountry. The route explores new M'Goun gorges where "riders will follow a mule trail through the river itself" according to race organizers. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. Altitude. 4 out of 5. Your sea-level FTP is a fiction up here. The new route crosses Tizi N'Aït Imi at 2,910m, the highest pass ever included in AMR. Prestige. 3 out of 5. Respected. Not yet legendary. Six years running as part of The Mountain Races series alongside Silk Road and Hellenic Mountain races. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Riders get exclusive access to new M'Goun gorge sections and mule trails impossible to replicate privately.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Community. 2 out of 5. Riders acknowledge each other. Barely. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Logistics. 1 out of 5. Good luck finding anything out there. Expenses. 1 out of 5. Cheap to do. No excuses.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: The case for Atlas Mountain Race.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Marrakech varies by start location
Lodging: Self-supported. Plan your own accommodation.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Extreme Atlas Mountains Ultra-Endurance. If you're an elite ultra-endurance rider with a big budget. maybe. For most riders. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Atlas Mountain Race isn't quite right for you. For similar ultra-endurance: Transcontinental Race. For better value: regional gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Atlas Mountain Race? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic pose, 'Atlas Mountain Race' bold text, tier badge 'ELITE', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
